title: Natchez Trace Parkway: Parks as Classrooms
body: Parks as Classrooms        Curriculum Materials The Natchez Trace Parkway has K-12 lesson plans covering most subjects. Our history lessons focus on the areas along the Old Trace.  Our science lessons focus on environment, habitat, animal classification, ecology and stream studies.  All Curriculum Materials     Field Trips Thanks to the National Park Foundation, we are able to pay for bus trips and substitute teachers for field trips to the Natchez Trace Parkway. Field Trips are available upon request. We cover several subject areas and all grade levels. Please call 662-680-4027 to schedule or learn about field trip options.  All Field Trips     Guest Speakers Rangers with interpretive and educational experience would love to come speak to or lead activities in your classroom. We can provide programs from kindergarten through college level. We also are happy to speak to your club or civic group. Our topics cover sciences, history, art, and more. Please call 662-680-4027 to schedule a program.  All Guest Speakers     Traveling Trunks We have several Traveling Trunks and Kits. Follow the link to browse through our collection of trunks and kits. In some cases, individual items may be checked out separately from the kit or trunk. Normally we cannot ship trunks at our expense, but we may be able to shuttle a trunk to a pick-up location on the Natchez Trace Parkway. Call 662-680-4027 for more information. All Traveling Trunks     Materials to Loan We are currently developing Materials to Loan. Currently most items from the Traveling Trunks can be checked out separately. If you have a suggestion for us to consider for development, please let us know. For information, please call 662-680-4027.  All Materials to Loan
